standard_metadata.standard_description: Use decimal notation for fractions with denominators 10 or 100.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Relate decimals and fractions in words

question.content: **Which of the following numbers are equivalent to $3$ hundredths?**

hints.content: ### Fraction form  Let's use a picture to see what $\blueD{ 3 \text{ hundredths}}$ looks like.      $\blueD{ 3}$ of the $\blueD{100}$ pieces are shaded.  We can write this as the fraction, $\blueD{\dfrac{3}{100}}$.

images.alt: A square with 3 of 100 equal parts shaded

hints.content: ###Decimal form  We can use a place value chart to write $\blueD{ 3 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | $0$ | $\blueD{3}$  $\blueD{3 \text{ hundredths}} = \blueD{0.03}$
The following numbers are equivalent to $\blueD{3 \text{ hundredths}}$:  - $\blueD{\dfrac{3}{100}}$      - $\blueD{0.03}$

question.content: **Which of the following numbers are equivalent to $54$ hundredths?**

hints.content: ### Fraction form  Let's use a picture to see what $\blueD{ 54 \text{ hundredths}}$ looks like.      $\blueD{ 54}$ of the $\blueD{100}$ pieces are shaded.  We can write this as the fraction, $\blueD{\dfrac{54}{100}}$.

images.alt: A square with 54 of 100 equal parts shaded

hints.content: ###Decimal form  We can use a place value chart to write $\blueD{ 54 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | $\blueD5$ | $\blueD{4}$  $\blueD{54 \text{ hundredths}} = \blueD{0.54}$
The following numbers are equivalent to $\blueD{54 \text{ hundredths}}$:  - $\blueD{\dfrac{54}{100}}$      - $\blueD{0.54}$

question.content: **Which of the following numbers are equivalent to $8$ tenths?**

hints.content: ### Fraction form  Let's use a picture to see what $\blueD{ 8 \text{ tenths}}$ looks like.      $\blueD{ 8}$ of the $\blueD{10}$ pieces are shaded.  We can write this as the fraction, $\blueD{\dfrac{8}{10}}$.

images.alt: A square with 8 of 10 equal parts shaded

hints.content: ###Decimal form  We can use a place value chart to write $\blueD{ 8 \text{ tenths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | $\blueD8$ |   $\blueD{8 \text{ tenths}} = \blueD{0.8}$
The following numbers are equivalent to $\blueD{8 \text{ tenths}}$:  - $\blueD{\dfrac{8}{10}}$      - $\blueD{0.8}$

question.content: **Which of the following numbers are equivalent to $5$ tenths?**

hints.content: ### Fraction form  Let's use a picture to see what $\blueD{ 5 \text{ tenths}}$ looks like.      $\blueD{ 5}$ of the $\blueD{10}$ pieces are shaded.  We can write this as the fraction, $\blueD{\dfrac{5}{10}}$.

images.alt: A square with 5 of 10 equal parts shaded

hints.content: ###Decimal form  We can use a place value chart to write $\blueD{ 5 \text{ tenths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | $\blueD5$ |   $\blueD{5 \text{ tenths}} = \blueD{0.5}$
The following numbers are equivalent to $\blueD{5 \text{ tenths}}$:  - $\blueD{\dfrac{5}{10}}$      - $\blueD{0.5}$

question.content: **Select the written form of each number.**

hints.content: ### $\blueD{0.4}$  We can use a place value chart to write $\blueD{0.4}$ in written form.  Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\blueD0$|$.$ | $\blueD{4}$|  $\blueD{0.4}=\blueD{4\text{ tenths}}$

### $\greenD{\dfrac{4}{10}}$  Let's use a picture to see what $\greenD{\dfrac{4}{10}}$ looks like.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\greenD{ 4}$ of the $\greenD{10}$ pieces are shaded.  We can write this as $\greenD{ 4\text{ tenths}}$.

images.alt: A square divided into ten equal-sized columns. The left four columns are shaded green.

hints.content: ### $\maroonD{0.04}$  We can use a place value chart to write $\maroonD{0.04}$ in written form.  Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\maroonD0$|$.$ | $\maroonD0$ | $\maroonD{4}$  $\maroonD{0.04}=\maroonD{4\text{ hundredths}}$
The figure below shows the written form of each number.  [[☃ categorizer 4]]

question.content: **Select the written form of each number.**

hints.content: ### $\blueD{1}$  We can use a place value chart to write $\blueD{1}$ in written form.  Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\blueD1$| | |  $\blueD{1}=\blueD{1\text{ one}}$

### $\greenD{\dfrac{1}{10}}$  Let's use a picture to see what $\greenD{\dfrac{1}{10}}$ looks like.     [[☃ image 1]]  $\greenD{ 1}$ of the $\greenD{10}$ pieces are shaded.  We can write this as $\greenD{ 1\text{ tenth}}$.

images.alt: A square divided into ten equal-sized columns. The left column is shaded green.

hints.content: ### $\maroonD{0.01}$  We can use a place value chart to write $\maroonD{0.01}$ in written form.  Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\maroonD0$|$.$ | $\maroonD0$ | $\maroonD{1}$  $\maroonD{0.01}=\maroonD{1\text{ hundredth}}$
The figure below shows the written form of each number.  [[☃ categorizer 5]]

question.content: **Select the written form of each number.**

hints.content: ### $\maroonD{0.7}$  We can use a place value chart to write $\maroonD{0.7}$ in written form.  Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\maroonD0$|$.$ | $\maroonD7$ |  $\maroonD{0.7}=\maroonD{7\text{ tenths}}$

### $\blueD{\dfrac{7}{100}}$  Let's use a picture to see what $\blueD{\dfrac{7}{100}}$ looks like.     [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{ 7}$ of the $\blueD{100}$ pieces are shaded.  We can write this as $\blueD{ 7\text{ hundredths}}$.

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in  10 columns of 10 squares each. The bottom seven squares in the first column are shaded.

hints.content: ### $\greenD{0.07}$  We can use a place value chart to write $\greenD{0.07}$ in written form.  Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\greenD0$|$.$ | $\greenD0$ | $\greenD7$  $\greenD{0.07}=\greenD{7\text{ hundredths}}$
The figure below shows the written form of each number.  [[☃ categorizer 2]]

question.content: **Select the written form of each number.**

hints.content: ### $\maroonD{0.32}$  We can use a place value chart to write $\maroonD{0.32}$ in written form.  Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\maroonD0$|$.$ | $\maroonD3$ | $\maroonD2$  $\maroonD{0.32}=\maroonD{32\text{ hundredths}}$

### $\blueD{\dfrac{32}{100}}$  Let's use a picture to see what $\blueD{\dfrac{32}{100}}$ looks like.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{ 32}$ of the $\blueD{100}$ pieces are shaded.  We can write this as $\blueD{ 32\text{ hundredths}}$.

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in  10 columns of 10 squares each. The left three columns are shaded. In the fourth column, the bottom two squares are shaded.

hints.content: ### $\greenD{32}$  We can use a place value chart to write $\greenD{32}$ in written form.  Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths  :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $\greenD3$ | $\greenD2$ | |  $\greenD{32}=\greenD{3\text{ tens and } 2\text{ ones}}$
The written form of each number is selected below.  [[☃ categorizer 3]]

The following numbers are equivalent to $\blueD{7 \text{ hundredths}}$:  - $\blueD{\dfrac{7}{100}}$      - $\blueD{0.07}$

question.content: **Write $48$ hundredths as a fraction and a decimal.**  Fraction:      Decimal:

hints.content: ### Fraction form  Let's use a picture to see what $\blueD{ 48 \text{ hundredths}}$ looks like.     [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueD{ 48}$ of the $\blueD{100}$ pieces are shaded.  We can write this as the fraction, $\blueD{\dfrac{48}{100}}$.

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal-sized squares that are set in  10 columns of 10 squares each. The left four columns are shaded. In the fifth column, the bottom eight squares are shaded.

hints.content: ###Decimal form  We can use a place value chart to write $\blueD{ 48 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens|Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-: |:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$0$|$.$  | $\blueD{4}$ | $\blueD{8}$  $\blueD{ 48 \text{ hundredths}} = \blueD{0.48}$
